intro: Ophiorrhiza nairii, commonly known as the Nair's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Olacaceae. It is native to the Indian subcontinent and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its seeds are dispersed by birds, which feed on its fleshy berries. Ophiorrhiza nairii is often found growing on the branches of host trees, where it derives some of its nutrients through its specialized roots.
